revised_title: Anatomy and Sensory Adaptations of the Ornithorhynchus paradoxus
tldr: The author examines the unique anatomy of the Ornithorhynchus paradoxus, also known as the platypus, and discovers that its beak is not a mouth but a part added to the mouth. The platypus has grinding teeth on each side of its upper and lower jaws and a short tongue. Its organ of smell is different from that of other animals, with two cavities along the length of its beak, which may help it detect prey in water.
